title: Track Github Cheat Sheet Updates Daily
_seo_title: Track Github Cheat Sheet (tiimgreen/github-cheat-sheet) Updates Daily - Track Awesome List
description: A list of cool features of Git and GitHub.

items.title: Github Cheat Sheet Updates on Feb 02, 2020
items.content_text:
### Keyboard Shortcuts / Compare Branches across Forked Repositories

*   Pressing `s` will focus the search field for the current repository. Pressing ‚Üì to select the ‚ÄúAll GitHub‚Äù option changes the field to search all of GitHub.
items.content_html:
Keyboard Shortcuts / Compare Branches across Forked Repositories

  • Pressing s will focus the search field for the current repository. Pressing ‚Üì to select the ‚ÄúAll GitHub‚Äù option changes the field to search all of GitHub.

items.title: Github Cheat Sheet Updates on Sep 08, 2016
items.content_text:
### Keyboard Shortcuts / Compare Branches across Forked Repositories

*   Pressing `y` **when looking at a file** (e.g., `https://github.com/tiimgreen/github-cheat-sheet/blob/master/README.md`) will change your URL to one which, in effect, freezes the page you are looking at. If this code changes, you will still be able to see what you saw at that current time.

### Git Grep / GitHub Talks

*   `-e` The next parameter is the pattern (e.g., regex)
items.content_html:
Keyboard Shortcuts / Compare Branches across Forked Repositories

  • Pressing y when looking at a file (e.g., https://github.com/tiimgreen/github-cheat-sheet/blob/master/README.md) will change your URL to one which, in effect, freezes the page you are looking at. If this code changes, you will still be able to see what you saw at that current time.

Git Grep / GitHub Talks

  • -e The next parameter is the pattern (e.g., regex)

items.title: Github Cheat Sheet Updates on Feb 07, 2016
items.content_text:
### Empty Commits / GitHub Talks

*   The first commit of a repository: `git commit -m "Initial commit" --allow-empty`.
items.content_html:
Empty Commits / GitHub Talks

  • The first commit of a repository: git commit -m "Initial commit" --allow-empty.

items.title: Github Cheat Sheet Updates on Jun 03, 2015
items.content_text:
### Git Grep / GitHub Talks

*   `--and`, `--or` and `--not` Combine multiple patterns.
items.content_html:
Git Grep / GitHub Talks

  • --and, --or and --not Combine multiple patterns.

items.title: Github Cheat Sheet Updates on Jan 21, 2015
items.content_text:
### Emojis / Compare Branches across Forked Repositories

*   `:shipit:`
*   `:sparkles:`
*   `:-1:`
*   `:+1:`
*   `:clap:`

items.title: Github Cheat Sheet Updates on May 18, 2014
items.content_text:
### Task Lists / Task Lists in Markdown Documents

*   [x] Earth
    *   [x] Moon
*   [x] Mars
    *   [ ] Deimos
    *   [ ] Phobos
items.content_html:
Task Lists / Task Lists in Markdown Documents

  • Earth
    • Moon
  • Mars
    • Deimos
    • Phobos

items.title: Github Cheat Sheet Updates on Apr 16, 2014
items.content_text:
### Stripspace / GitHub Talks

*   Strips trailing whitespace
*   Collapses newlines
*   Adds newline to end of file
items.content_html:
Stripspace / GitHub Talks

  • Strips trailing whitespace
  • Collapses newlines
  • Adds newline to end of file

items.title: Github Cheat Sheet Updates on Apr 14, 2014
items.content_text:
### Keyboard Shortcuts / Compare Branches across Forked Repositories

*   Pressing `t` will bring up a file explorer.
*   Pressing `w` will bring up the branch selector.
*   Pressing `l` will edit labels on existing Issues.

### Empty Commits / GitHub Talks

*   Annotating the start of a new bulk of work or a new feature.
*   Documenting when you make changes to the project that aren't code related.
*   Communicating with people using your repository.
items.content_html:
Keyboard Shortcuts / Compare Branches across Forked Repositories

  • Pressing t will bring up a file explorer.
  • Pressing w will bring up the branch selector.
  • Pressing l will edit labels on existing Issues.

Empty Commits / GitHub Talks

  • Annotating the start of a new bulk of work or a new feature.
  • Documenting when you make changes to the project that aren't code related.
  • Communicating with people using your repository.
